abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Emergency
            Agriculture Production Project for Gambia, The, is to
            improve access to agricultural inputs, equipment and
            postharvest storage capacity by targeted farmers in nine
            vulnerable districts. Negative impacts include: local air
            pollution, minimal local air pollution, pollution of surface
            water due to runoff and improper application, impede
            movement of livestock due to gullies, disposal of used oil,
            and disposal of used spare parts. Mitigation measures
            include: use enclosed trucks/cover fertilizer stocks; store
            seeds away from dwellings and stored food; train farmers and
            extension worker on the right application rates and contour
            farming; proper ventilation of seed stores; training on soil
            and water conservation; avoid disposal used oil into or near
            water bodies; regular preventive maintenance; accidental
            spillage near water bodies must be immediately cleaned; and
            training on soil and water conservation techniques for
            participating members of the Seed Growers Association to be
            able to avoid soil degradation.
